properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms early this evening. A line of showers and thunderstorms will move eastward across the regions early this evening. Wind gusts of 80 km/h are possible with some of these storms. Torrential downpours, cloud-to-ground lightning and hail may also be associated. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-24T14:28:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-23T22:29:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2092106858.2020
Area: Western Algonquin Park - Lake of Two Rivers
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Risk of severe thunderstorms with wind gusts of 90 km/h. Thunderstorms are expected to move eastward across the regions this evening. Hazards: Isolated wind gusts of 90 km/h. Cloud-to-ground lightning. Brief poor visibilities and ponding of water on roads in torrential downpours. Timing: This evening. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Hail and locally heavy rain are also possible. Water-related activities may be unsafe due to violent and sudden gusts of wind over bodies of water. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-10-24T15:11:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-23T23:12:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1295112032.2020
Area: Simcoe - Delhi - Norfolk, St. Thomas - Aylmer - Eastern Elgin County, Woodstock - Tillsonburg - Oxford County, Brantford - County of Brant, Uxbridge - Beaverton - Northern Durham Region, Newmarket - Georgina - Northern York Region, Huntsville - Baysville, Port Carling - Port Severn, Bracebridge - Gravenhurst, Fenelon Falls - Balsam Lake Park - Northern Kawartha Lakes, Guelph - Erin - Southern Wellington County, Kitchener - Cambridge - Region of Waterloo, Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus, Caledon
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are possible this evening for areas along the eastern shore of Reindeer Lake, with conditions weakening overnight. Snow squalls may redevelop late Saturday afternoon through the overnight. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to heavy snow and snow will quickly accumulate with another 15 cm possible before Sunday morning. ### Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-24T18:34:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-24T02:35:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0301081682.2020
Area: Lynn Lake, Leaf Rapids, Pukatawagan

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Southerly winds will reach up to 90 kilometres per hour beginning this morning. These winds will diminish near midday. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h, except 100 along parts of the coast. Locations: Nain and vicinity. Time span: near midnight tonight until early Sunday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-25T00:05:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-24T08:06:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0931280774.2020
Area: Nain and vicinity

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow will continue tonight and taper off throughout the day Saturday. Snowfall totals are expected to be in the 10 to 20 cm range, with the highest amounts in the extreme southwestern foothills. In the Lethbridge region, the highest snowfall amounts are expected to be over southern portions of the region, near the U.S. border. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. There may be a significant impact on rush hour traffic in urban areas. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-24T22:43:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-24T06:44:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3495263901.2020

properties.Title: Tropical Cyclone Information Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: For Hurricane Epsilon. The next information statement will be issued by 9:30 p.m. NDT Saturday. Summary of basic information at 9:30 p.m. NDT. Location: Near 36.0 North 61.7 West. About 1400 kilometres southwest of Cape Race. Maximum sustained winds: 140 kilometres per hour. Present movement: North at 19 kilometres per hour. Minimum central pressure: 968 millibars. Hurricane Epsilon will enter the Canadian Response Zone tonight and will then turn to the northeast. Epsilon is not expected to have any direct impacts on Canadian land areas. However, swell waves are expected to build along the southern coastlines of Nova Scotia and Newfoundland Saturday night and Sunday. The largest waves reaching the coast are expected over the southern Avalon Peninsula where waves of 4 to 7 metres are expected. Over the south coast of Newfoundland from the Burin Peninsula and west to Port aux Basques, waves of 3 to 5 metres are expected. Along the Atlantic coast of Nova Scotia, waves of 3 to 4 metres are likely. Some rain from a developing trough of low pressure well ahead of Epsilon will spread over southeastern Newfoundland Saturday evening, but the center of Epsilon will track well offshore near the southeastern corner of the Grand Banks early on Sunday. Gale to storm force winds are expected over southeastern offshore waters. Over the southern edge of the Southwestern Grand Banks and the southern edge of the Southeastern Grand Banks, hurricane force winds will likely occur. Waves over the southeastern offshore waters are expected to be generally 6 to 9 metres except over the southern edges of the southern Grand Banks where waves of 9 to 12 metres are expected. The Canadian Hurricane Centre will provide another update on Epsilon by 9:30 PM NDT Saturday. Forecaster(s): Hatt/Couturier ### Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-10-25T05:35:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-23T23:36:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0679770575.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Additional Snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Locations: Churchill Falls and Churchill Valley. Time span: continuing until near noon today. Remarks: Snow, at times heavy, is expected to become mixed with ice pellets this morning. Snow and ice pellets will change to rain later this morning as temperatures rise. ### Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
